title: Program Manager, Defense Programs (OCEA-N)
content:
Title: Program Manager, Defense Programs
Who Are You?
You are an experienced customer success/project manager for complex software as a service deployments to Government customers.  You are a quick learner, self-starter, organized, and self-motivated. You have a bias for action and are meticulous about details. You enjoy being in a customer facing role and can easily speak with all levels of management. You’re comfortable with technology and enjoy learning new tools, datasets, and analytic techniques. You have a passion for continuous learning and strive to understand our customers’ unique pain points and helping them find creative solutions. You are not easily intimidated by a challenge and enjoy wearing multiple hats. You can assess the utility of a technological tool and understand and communicate its functions to both explain and improve it. You take pride and ownership in your work and being the face of Exiger. You work well independently or in a cross-functional team.
Skills for Success in this role

Ability to quickly gain expertise in Exiger’s range of products and capabilities
Strong Microsoft Office skills- particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Clear oral and written communication skills
Advanced writing and editing abilities
Ability to give confident and informative in-person and virtual presentations
Meticulously organized, detail oriented, and maintain detailed and accurate records
Ability to manage project timelines, resources, and tasks
Analytical mindset to collect and analyze information, problem-solve, and make decisions or informed recommendations to customers
Open to receiving and giving constructive feedback to push the business forward

A Day In The Life
Your daily mission as a Program Manager is to:

Make your clients successful in their unique mission and;
Grow Exiger by providing value to your customers and peers

Everything you do revolves around this mission, which means every day is different because your client’s needs are always changing and evolving. On a given day, you could do any of the following:

Oversee and participate in deployment and delivery of, and overall management of various technical and analytical requirements for Exiger's Platform, products, or services
Develop a presentation that outlines Exiger’s core technology
Onboard new users and brief them on all the capabilities we can provide
Imagine new ways to apply Exiger’s technology to the client’s mission and work with the internal team to test and execute
Conduct training (in-person or virtual) on how to apply the Exiger’s technology to their mission
Advise your clients on how best to utilize the software and tools they’ve purchased
Conduct initial troubleshooting on technical issues for your clients and work with the tech team to resolve
Translate your client’s needs and mission into products Exiger can offer and confidently present them to the client
Provide internal training and education on Exiger tools, processes, and supply chain risks
Provide feedback to analysts based on client needs
Provide support and feedback to/from the Account Team about client satisfaction and requirements
Work closely with the Account Manager to ensure client success
Analyze Exiger data to make informed recommendations to the client
And much, much more!

Qualifications

Seven (7) years of experience
Experience supporting similar technical and managerial functions for Government customers (DoD preferred).


Active TS Clearance Required
Located in Washington, DC area. Required to work on client site in a SCIF (hybrid may be an option at a later time)
Ability to work remotely, if required
National security, intelligence, government, or military department experience preferred
Experience in supply chain risk management (SCRM)
Bachelor’s degree or background in a software, technology, supply chain, political science, or national security related field

We’re an amazing place to work. Why?

Discretionary Time Off for all employees, with no maximum limits on time off
Industry leading health, vision, and dental benefits
Competitive compensation package
16 weeks of fully paid parental leave
Flexible, hybrid approach to working from home and in the office where applicable
Focus on wellness and employee health through stipends and dedicated wellness programming
Purposeful career development programs with reimbursement provided for educational certifications

 Exiger is revolutionizing the way corporations, government agencies and banks manage risk and compliance with a combination of technology-enabled and SaaS solutions. In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.
